title: (x) Country Road logo / Typophile - ITC Avant Garde Gothic / Gotham {Yves}
content:
Trying to find the typeface used in Australia’s Country Road clothing label logo. Any ideas?

It actually looks a little like the tyepface used in Typophile’s logo. I’d be interested to hear what that tyepface is, too.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [countryroad.png](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=countryroad.png) | 7.82 KB |
author: the_wellspring

comments.content: The “Country Road” logo is set in [ITC Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125213358/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&startrow=1&records=&currpage=1&totalrecords=3&displayfontid=EF.369.0.0&fontRendererText=COUNTRY+ROAD) — Typophile uses [Gotham](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125213358/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gotham/index.html) as its primary sans face, although the Typophile logo used to be / is (?) set in a wide weight of [Knockout](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125213358/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/knockout/index.html).

Wow, that was quick. Thanks so much!

I thought it was the ITC Avante Garde Gothic, but the logo’s letters seem a little bit squarer and blockier - the U and T especially seem to be a little wider. Also, there’s some space between the downward stroke of the R and its outward pointing leg…
It possibly is a pre-digital version. Remember those faces were interpreted for several technologies.

It was designed in Melbourne by Fabio Ongarato you could send him a question via their website to find out more about it maybe? [http://www.fodesign.com.au/index.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20051125213358/http:/www.fodesign.com.au/index.php)

Dom
